com.rossbille.common.eithers

Class Either<TLeft,TRight>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rossbille.common.eithers.Either<TLeft,TRight>
  • Type Parameters:
    TLeft - the type of the left value
    TRight - the type of the right value

    public class Either<TLeft,TRight>
extends Object
    An Either is an object that can contain either a value of type TLeft or TRight but never both. By convention an Either contains a right value if a function has executed successfully and left otherwise
    Author:
    RossBille

        public void match(java.util.function.Consumer<TLeft> ofLeft,
                  java.util.function.Consumer<TRight> ofRight)
        Runs ofLeft if this either contains a left value or ofRight if it contains a right value
        Parameters:

      • match

        Applies ofLeft if this either contains a left value or ofRight if it contains a right value
        Type Parameters:
        Out - the return type
        Parameters:
        ofLeft - the function to run if this either contains a left value
        ofRight - the function to run if this either contains a right value
        Returns:
        the result of the function that is applied of type Out
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either functions are null
